text:
Your logging level was great!  We discover...

MSI (c) (F0:10) [15:51:49:562]: Invoking remote custom action. DLL:
c:\Temp\MSI72.tmp, Entrypoint: _ResolveServerName@4
MSI (c) (F0:14) [15:51:49:578]: Cloaking enabled.
MSI (c) (F0:14) [15:51:49:578]: Attempting to enable all disabled priveleges
before calling Install on Server
MSI (c) (F0:14) [15:51:49:578]: Connected to service for CA interface.
MSI (c) (F0!2C) [15:51:49:718]: PROPERTY CHANGE: Modifying RESOLVED_WINSOCK2
property. Its current value is '0'. Its new value: '1'.

  so ResolveServerName found and initialized WinSock2 services.

Action ended 15:51:49: ResolveServerName. Return value 3.

  It failed to resolve your host name for your IP address and
  died.  Looking at alternatives so this failure isn't quite
  so drastic.

creator: drmikepiff@gmail.com
text: I should add that 2.0.51 installs without a hitch on exactly the same machine.

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
(In reply to comment #3)
> This bug persists with Apache 2.2.2

To clarify, the code's in the installer, it's not associated with 2.2.2 or
2.0.58 (also affected).

So will explore and hopefully have a new package done in the next week that
resolves the issue.  Another minor nit is that some dns resolvers/configurations
will report that the domain name ends in a period, which should be stripped by
this very code.  E.g. you might see 'ep145.rtr-5521.bigtelco.com.' where you
didn't expect to see that trailing '.' in your configure servername/domain
dialog box.

creator: drmikepiff@gmail.com
text:
Hang on, how can the host name for my "server" be resolved when I have a private
IP address?  I am doing testing behind a firewall.

creator: wrowe@apache.org
